diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute perforated appendicitis with local abscess formation, Postoperative ileus
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with dull, diffuse, crampy abdominal pain that progressed to sharper pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), along with anorexia and signs of peritonitis on physical examination. Imaging studies showed nonspecific bowel gas patterns but indicated an acute abdominal process requiring surgical intervention.
